message: My company, located NW Chicago, is looking for a couple more developers - Web UI/Javascript/CSS an/or NetSuite experience desired. Ping me if you want to know more or chat at PyCon.
My team at Cox Media Group Digital is looking to add several more Python developers. We're in Atlanta but open to telework. Ping me or grab me at PyCon for more details. http://j.mp/bYY62H
The Washington (DC) Times is hiring Django developers! Get a hold of me any way you can. I'll be at PyCon.
@cmheisel Lets grab lunch at pycon :}
any canadian company that could accept foreign guys like me? :-P
MochiMedia (SF) is hiring: http://mochimedia.com/jobs/
anyone hiring in California? :D
I'd be interested in talking with any web developer types (either designer or programmer) from the Toronto or Waterloo. I'm part of a startup which is building furniture mass-customization software.

Racemi (http://www.racemi.com/) is hiring a QA Automation Engineer for our server image management and cloud migration tools. We're a small company, so it is a good opportunity for you to have a lot of input into how things work. Email me (doug dot hellmann at gmail) or catch me at the conference this week for more details.

Google is hiring for all sorts of projects all around the world. I am specifically looking for people interested in the Linux kernel, git and distributed systems with a C/C++ and Python bent for my team in California.
We (Library of Congress) have three Django developer positions open: http://www.python.org/community/jobs/#caci-washington-dc-usa

Milo (http://milo.com/) is hiring all sorts of python talent in San Jose, CA. We were bought by eBay in December and are very independent from the main corp. Catch up with me at the conference for more info.
We're (ShootQ + Pictage) hiring in Atlanta as well. I'll be setting up a little get together to have drinks with any interested parties. Feel free to contact me directly, though!

Enthought is hiring: Scientific Software Developers, Financial Software Developers, IT Architect, and Web Services and Application Developer.  See details and RSVP to our PyCon recruiting event http://enthought.com/pyconrecruiting.php
@sontek Sounds good I'm cmheisel on Freenode if you want to link up on Friday/Sat/Sunday
The Discovery Channel is hiring a Django developer / Python developer who's willing to learn in Silver Spring, MD (one metro stop outside of DC).

Zoro Tools, located NW Chicago, is looking for a couple more Python developers - with Web UI/JQuery/CSS for one and Linux/EC2/NetSuite for the other. Grab me in the halls or email me at vceder at gmail dot com and I will connect you to the boss. Hey, I might even buy you a beer. ;)
MyRozi, an early-stage healthcare startup, is hiring. The team is distributed in Providence, RI; Waltham, MA; and Palo Alto. Contact me at andrew.shearer, at the domain myrozi.com.
Ooo discovery channel. Enticing!
Does that mean I get to travel scuba dive and work on django.. if so. Then count me in.
http://agoragames.com/ is also hiring, find me or send me an email at vbabiy@agoragames.com
@nyxtom well, there's no one stopping you from using your vacation time to travel and scuba dive... So in that sense, yes.
bitly is happy to speak with distributed systems developers (and any brilliant developers, for that matter).  Come find @hmason, @jehiah, or @toddml

Prezi is also looking for a Python engineer (but we have other positions open as well): http://prezi.com/jobs-eng-backend/ If you're interested in a gig in the heart of Central Europe, just ping me during the conference.
@nyxtom if you can provide a video of you coding while scuba diving I will hire you on the spot. (But you'll have to come to DC to work.)
@joshourisman I have no concept of vacation, code comes with me wherever I go :P
DISQUS is always looking for awesome engineers. Come hear why you should join our team as we surpass the 500 million visitor mark Sunday :)
We're hiring application and platform developers at Emma in Nashville and Portland as well! Super fun place to work. http://myemma.com/
Scripps Media is looking for Djangonauts with full lifecycle experience. Ping me on Twitter or track us down at Pycon. Details at bit.ly/ghBZX9
uStudio in Austin, Texas is looking for Python devs -- Tornado, Celery, ffmpeg, and MongoDb are just some of the cool toys we play with!

Hearsay in San Francisco -- we're hiring front- and back-end developers, Django + Celery + Chef stack but happy to talk to any smart hackers. @rbm on twitter, rmaccloy on freenode -- or find one of us wandering the conference.
http://pnl.bwh.harvard.edu is hiring for my current position: Research Assistant.  Interest in neuroimaging is #1 qualification, but having Python experience is #2.  I'd love to talk about it.
@wolever Yo, toronto developer checking in. I am not looking to be hired, but always interested in talking
My company is hiring Django devs in Los Angeles, CA (http://cartwheelweb.com) @jamespaxi

dotCloud in San Francisco -- we're hiring smart hackers, bonus if you're fluent in Python, have sysadmin skills, want to play with zeromq, riak, or other bleeding edge open source projects (http://www.dotcloud.com) hello@dotcloud.com

Mozilla is hiring - Mountain View or other locations (you can work remote) lots of positions: Web Developer - Rapid Development, Web Application Security Engineer, Software Engineer - Mozilla Services & Open Web Apps, Labs Software Engineer, Release Engineer - there are several Mozilla folks at PyCon and any of us can chat with you about working at Mozilla, but check out http://hire.jobvite.com/CompanyJobs/Careers.aspx?k=JobListing&c=qpX9Vfwa&v=1 too.
Truecar.com in Santa Monica is hiring Python developers. ( http://www.truecar.com/hiring.html ). Come see us at our booth in the Expo hall.
Rackspace is hiring http://jobs.rackspace.com/search?q=python
@dimitri_gnidash awesome. Meet up at lunch? I'll be in the 12:30 slot, after Alex's talk.
@wolever @dimity_gnidash I'll join you for lunch.
@cleverdevil made it to Hanover a I may be standing behind you lol
Truecar.com is having a raffle for a free iPad 2 at our booth in the Expo hall. Yes, we got one before they sold out.
FreshBooks is hiring in Toronto, Ontario!  http://careers.freshbooks.com
@aisipos and how does one enter this raffle?
@lsblakk Yes, come by the booth and we've got a computer running an app to let you enter the raffle. Yes, the app is written in Python/Django. ;)
@cleverdevil I wanted to ask you a few more questions and what your thoughts were about leveraging eventlet and/or real time components.
haha yea, it's the pycon theme
@lsblakk go to their stand, give them personal info (email, number, etc)
Anyone doing any work with redis, celery, twisted?
Oh yea, duh! lol
And we are hiring :)
The divider wall stopped the previous rounds of talks in III and IV, so both went overtime.
@nyxtom we (ShootQ) use Redis and Celery, but not Twisted.
Like everyone else, apparently.
@cleverdevil Want to do lunch?
Anyone got part-time telecommuting gigs?
@nyxtom sure. In the virtualenv BoF right now in Hanover A. I'll be here until lunch at 12:15 or so. Feel free to come meet me here and we will head to lunch.
is anyone hiring for telecommuting positions?
@mattg -- We are at Cox Media Group Digital
hi friends, the Threadless jobs are posted: http://www.threadless.com/jobs
